Items.deck: The sequel to Galcon, Galcon Labs was released for the iPhone in 2009 with all the contents from its predecessor as well as new modes and tweaks to the gameplay.
Items.name: Galcon Labs

Items.deck: Japanese eroge that tell the story of 3 sisters that all feel the same, say one gets hurt, they all feel hurt
Items.name: Doushin: Same Heart

Items.deck: A bowling game from Jaleco for the Famicom Disk System. It is the fourth and final in the "Big Challenge!" series.
Items.name: Big Challenge! Go! Go! Bowling

Items.deck: Goiken Muyou II is the PlayStation follow-up to 1997's Saturn fighter Goiken Muyou: Anarchy in the Nippon.
Items.name: Goiken Muyou II

Items.deck: An instructional Shogi game, that teaches the Japanese version of chess. It is hosted by Tanigawa Kouji, a top-tier Shogi player. It was released for the Famicom Disk System, NES and MSX.
Items.name: Tanigawa Kouji no Shogi Shinan II

Items.deck: A hacking real time strategy game by Reality Council.
Items.name: Wetware

Items.deck: Movie tie-in based upon the film which was released on March 24th, 2009.
Items.name: Monsters vs. Aliens

Items.deck: A platformer with adventure games elements featuring the robotic cat Doraemon released for the Super Famicom by SAS Sakata. It follows Doraemon: Nobita to Yousei no Kuni.
Items.name: Doraemon 2: Nobita no Toys Land Daibouken

Items.deck: An arcade game developed by Full Circle Game Studio, released on iOS.
Items.name: Epic Beard 2

Items.deck: A SNES platformer based on the dialogue-free manga with the same name about a tiny dinosaur with a huge appetite.
Items.name: Gon

Items.deck: Red Tie Miner: Zombie is an Xbox Live Indie game.
Items.name: Red Tie Miner: Zombie

Items.deck: Contra 4 brings classic side-scrolling action to the DS as Earth is faced with a new menace, and four of Earth's strongest soldiers have been chosen to fight back on Galluga Island.

concepts.name: Western Games Based on Japanese IPs

Items.deck: Moulin Rouge Senki: Melville no Honoo is a strategy game released in 1989 for the Nintendo Famicom.
Items.name: Moulin Rouge Senki: Melville no Honoo

Items.deck: A variant of the roguelike game Larn with graphics.
Items.name: XLarn

Items.deck: On a 4x4 grid, slide pieces with numbers on them either up, down, left, or right. After every move a 2 piece or a 4 piece will appear in a random position on the board. When two of the same numbers are slid together, their pieces combine and the number doubles.
A PlayStation Vita exclusive puzzle platformer where the game world is made out of infographics representing statistics about the player's current gameplay session.
Items.name: Metrico

Items.deck: Small Booster pack for Hearts of Iron 2: Doomsday with many small changes.
Items.name: Hearts of Iron II: Doomsday - Armageddon

Items.deck: All-Star Basketball
Items.name: All-Star Basketball

Items.deck: An RPG set in Ancient Japan for the Super Famicom. It belongs to the same series as the PC Engine RPG Benkei Gaiden.
Items.name: Benkei Gaiden: Suna no Shou

Items.deck: A combat flight sim featuring the F-16 Fighting Falcon that was heralded as revolutionary, realistic, and attainable by both Arcade players and flight jockeys alike. It kicked off the Falcon series.
Items.name: Falcon

Items.deck: A first person shooter developed and published by Silden.
Items.name: Sniper The Manhunter

Items.deck: Space Rocks is an old school space shooter inspired by the Atari classic Asteroids.
Items.name: Space Rocks

Items.deck: Inspired by Irish folklore, Song of the Deep is a 2D, side-scrolling, underwater action-adventure game from Insomniac Games.
Items.name: Song of the Deep

Items.deck: Dragon Oath, also known as Tian Long Ba Bu in China, is a free-to-play MMORPG developed and published by Changyou.com and Sohu and launched in May 2007. The game's story is based on the novel Demi-Gods and Semi-Devils by Louis Cha.
Items.name: Dragon Oath

Items.deck: A Japanese PC Engine exclusive horizontal shoot 'em up. Power-ups appear as rings around the player's ship.
Items.name: W Ring: The Double Rings

Items.deck: A cartoon creation program for DOS and Apple IIgs.
Items.name: Cartooners

Items.deck: A 2D retro style RPG and the fifth game in the Aveyond series.
Items.name: Aveyond: The Lost Orb

Items.deck: A free application on Wii U that allows players to hang out in the plaza with their favorite villagers and import their photos from Animal Crossing: New Leaf save them to a gallery and share them on the Wii U Miiverse. The service ended on January 1st 2015.
Items.name: Animal Crossing Plaza

Items.deck: Tennis no Ouji-Sama: Sweat & Tears is a release in the Prince of Tennis video game series.
Items.name: Tennis no Ouji-Sama: Sweat & Tears

Items.deck: Stronghold Warchest is a pack that contains two FireFly games: Stronghold and Stronghold Crusader.
Items.name: FireFly Studios' Stronghold Warchest

Items.deck: Mario Andretti Racing is a driving game featuring the professional race car driver Mario Andretti.
Items.name: Mario Andretti Racing

Items.deck: Willy The Worm is a platform game for DOS. It was created by Alan Farmer and released in June, 1985.
Items.name: Willy The Worm

Items.deck:
8 bit action platform.
Avoid traps and lava. Swing on ropes, run around and collect gold.
Items.name: Caverns of Khafka

Items.deck: The fifth entry in the Wizardry series is a wholly independent adventure taking the series' formula and pitting the player against the threat of great evil dwelling within a vast maze beneath a castle. Only the brave need apply in delving into the mysteries surrounding the Heart of the Maelstrom.
Items.name: Wizardry V: Heart of the Maelstrom

Items.deck: Vektor Prix is a fast paced combat racing game with a full-color vector display. It supports single-player and multiplayer, AI bots of varying difficulty, a variety of weapons, entities to interact with, controller support, and game modes such as racing, deathmatch, or team deathmatch.
Items.name: Vektor Prix

Items.deck: Shariki (Russian: Balloons) is the original match three game. It was developed by Russian programmer Eugene Alemzhinym for DOS in 1994.
Items.name: Shariki

Items.deck: Slashers: The Power Battle is a weapon-based fantasy 2D fighting game. It is the sequel to the Game Boy Advance title "Dual Blades".
Items.name: Slashers: The Power Battle

Items.deck: A turn-based tactics game with RPG elements set in the "Weird West".
Items.name: Hard West

Items.deck: The third installment in the Legends of Wrestling series.
Items.name: Showdown: Legends of Wrestling

Items.deck: Fight against the approaching zombie horde in this Hack and Slash set in the medieval era, that combines a powerful scythe with upgradeable guns.
Items.name: Twin Blades

Items.deck: Firewind is a horizontal scrolling shooter set in space, released for DOS in 1996. It is not related to the Greek metal band.
Items.name: Firewind

Items.deck: A text adventure game developed by Allan Morton and Keith Bolam that was published by Gemtime in 1983.
Items.name: Murder at the Manor

Items.deck: Bad Day L.A. is a third-person action adventure game that parodies popular culture and the culture of fear of the United States. In the game, the city of Los Angeles suffers a series of over-the-top disasters including an earthquake, terrorist attack, zombie uprising, meteor bombardment, and Mexican invasion.
Items.name: American McGee Presents: Bad Day L.A.

concepts.name: Character Says The Name of The Game

publishers.name: The Mauretania Import Export Company (TMIEC), Inc.

Items.deck: A cyberpunk adventure about Ranson Stark, who wakes up infected by vampirism. Still retaining his human mind thanks to a cybernetic implant, he only has a limited time to find a cure before the implant breaks down and the infection takes control.
Items.name: BloodNet

Items.deck: A collection of party games for the PC.
Items.name: Yahtzee, Parcheesi & Aggravation Collection

Items.deck: A new music game from Tapulous that has you using your iPhone accelerometer to guide a marble down a ribbon without falling off the side.
Items.name: Riddim Ribbon

Items.deck: The fourth installment of the main Sims franchise, revamping the series's customization features while improving the Sims' automations and emotions.

Items.deck: A SNES-exclusive sequel to Taito's side-scrolling brawler Sonic Blast Man. The eponymous Sonic Blast Man is joined by two other heroes: Captain Choyear and Sonia.

Items.deck: Visual novel about a group of youths attempting to reconnect after witnessing two moons in the sky, reminding them of a similar event from their childhood.

Items.deck: A deliberately-retro side-scrolling platformer and loose adaptation of what is considered one of the worst films ever made.

Items.deck: An expansion pack to the strategy game Decisive Battles of WWII Vol 2: Korsun Pocket. It focuses around the military conflict known as Operation Barbarossa.

Items.deck: Improving on the original Silent Scope, Dark Silhouette featured a longer campaign, co-op arcade play, divergent paths depending on character choice, and a European setting.

SkyDrift is an arcade style, aerial racing game that was released Sept. 7, 2011 on XBLM and PS3N.
It was later released on Nov.21, 2011 on Steam.
